territory.long-form-name: Territory of the French Southern and Antarctic Lands
territory.notes: Overseas territory of France. The history of each of the constituent land features—Iles Eparses, Ile Amsterdam, Ile Saint Paul, Iles Crozet, Iles Kerguelen, Adelie Land, Bassas da India, Europa Island, Glorioso Islands, Juan de Nova Island, and Tromelin Island—is discussed briefly in the CIA World Factbook source. This source also notes that the U.S. Government does not recognize Adelie Land, the only non-insular district of the Territory and a thin slice of the Antarctic continent, as a French dependency.
